data.title: attraction
data.text: Represents Joe Louis, many people didn't know that Joe Louis grew up in Detroit not New York, located in the heart of downtown, stone throw from Hart Plaza, Renaissance Center, Coleman Young Center, Detroit River

data.title: Art, Go Figure
data.text: I do understand Mr Louis was a boxer, wonder if this was meant to be a kinetic sculpture.  Lots of art in the downtown area.

data.title: Fist Bump to Joe Louis
data.text: My husband had read about this Fist and wanted to see it. We rode the people mover to the GM Headquarters building and walked a couple of blocks to see this sculpture. It is quite large. We were so happy we took the time to go see it. Enjoy.

data.title: A nice symbol and piece of art
data.text: When you are near the water and GM building you are not far from the Joe Louis Monument. This is a great symbol of Detroit and is certainly worth walking to. It is disappointing that it is in the middle of a busy area which makes it tougher to take in. But that shouldn't stop you from walking by and taking it in.

data.title: Example of Detroit ART
data.text: It is one statute close to many more. If you like statutes this is just one example of the emphasis on street art that Detroit exhibits.

data.title: Nice monument
data.text: This Monument easily draws your attention, nice for a quick picture but not more. please be aware that currently the monument is not located where shown in trip advisor. Due to construction work it has been moved to a very busy crossing near Hart Plaza

data.title: The most fitting tribute ever to Detroit's #1 boxing legend
data.text: Pendulum one way ticket to Canada if you misbehave at a Hart plaza show. Seriously, has there ever been a better statue?

data.title: Nice Find
data.text:
We were driving around sight-seeing in downtown Detroit when I drove by this fist. It immediately struck my attention! My sister googled "fist in Detroit" and found out that this is a JOE LEWIS monument!! I just HAD to get out of the car and take a selfie!!!

Now I have to research and see why a Joe Lewis monument would be in Detroit. I didn't see any plaques or materials explaining the monument or labeling it. I asked the locals if this was intact a representation of Joe Lewis and everyone confirmed. I gave it a 4star vs a 5star because there  is nothing there (that I saw) to educate folks about this monument

data.title: Legend! to just go here and remember such a boxer is worth it
data.text: Another great sight of Detroit the Joe Louis Monument, Be careful when crossing the road to it, As its right smack bang in the middle of the road, Being British we have a tendency To run across roads.

data.title: Detroit's finest
data.text: Different looking monument. Smaller than I expected. Location is actually terrible.. in the middle of a very busy intersection. We had to ask the traffic control guard to let us go see the monument. A must see though if in Detroit!

data.title: Neat photo op
data.text: Pretty neat photo op if you want to cross traffic.  It's a unique monument, right next to two others (one being the Spirit of Detroit, and the other is the "Transcendence" monument).  Detroit is an awesome city.  I can't wait to visit it again.

data.title: Should it just be a fist?
data.text: An interesting pice of street art, but it should surely be just a fist suspended in the act of boxing?

data.title: Cruising Lovers
data.text: We noted this structure in passing, as we were crossing the intersection. We were not sure what it was.

data.title: LuigiSLP
data.text: a provocative piece of public art.  it is located between two busy intersections but it's worth the introspection.  Great tribute to the powerful Joe Louis who is from Detroit.

data.title: 5 Minute Attraction
data.text:
In downtown Detroit, on a traffic circle, you will see the monument to legendary native son, Joe Louis.  It's his fist hung on a trapeze.  Drive by, get a picture and  move on.  

If you miss it, your friends will  not condemn you!

data.title: Traffic is problematic for some photographs
data.text: Very unique monument, difficult to get photos from a distance due to traffic as the area in front is a two lane street.

data.title: Why???
data.text: Why just a fist?  Local legend says that it is a Detroit joke, punching out Canada.  Who knows?  Why out in the middle of a traffic circle?

data.title: Interesting
data.text: This is fun to see. Lots of pictures were being taken when we were here. It was cold but people were waiting there turn.

data.title: Awesome tribute to a great man
data.text: You can get close to this memorial.  It is right no the Detroit river boarding the USA and Canada.  You can get right up to the memorial and have your picture taking under the fist.

data.title: Really, welcome to Detroit!
data.text: I love Loe Louis story, but really, welcome to Detroit: a big fist in your eye. We are barely out of the distinction of murder capital of the country. As art, this is all the artist could come up with. I promised to vote for the first Mayor that would take it off Jefferson. Now moved to inside Cobo Hall I think.
